paper_metadata.title: Genome silencer therapy leading to ‘regression’ of cardiac amyloid load on cardiovascular magnetic resonance: a case report
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.Gly67Ala, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv amyloidosis with mixed phenotype (neuropathy and cardiomyopathy)

individual_records.phenotype_details: mixed amyloidosis phenotype with neuropathy and cardiomyopathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We report the case of a 53-year-old male with ATTRv amyloidosis. A heterozygote mutation in the transthyretin gene (p.Gly67Ala) was known in his family and also confirmed in his case 17 years before.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with hereditary ATTRv amyloidosis, leading to progressive neuropathy and cardiomyopathy.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is known in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The patient has a family history of the variant.
key_quotes: A heterozygote mutation in the transthyretin gene (p.Gly67Ala) was known in his family and also confirmed in his case 17 years before.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
